com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.service

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.service.Request

  • public class Request
extends Object
    Convenience class for constructing HTTP/HTTPS requests.
    Example: 
      HttpRequestBase request = Request
     .Get("/v1/translate")
     .withQuery("from", "en", "to", "es", "text", "Good Morning")
     .build();
    Author:
    German Attanasio Ruiz

      Builds a request with the given set of parameters and files.
      static Request Delete(String url, Object... args)
      The DELETE method requests that the origin server delete the resource identified by the Request-URI.
      static Request Get(String url, Object... args)
      The GET method means retrieve whatever information (in the form of an entity) is identified by the Request-URI.
      static Request Post(String url, Object... args)
      The POST request method is designed to request that a web server accept the data enclosed in the request message's body for storage.
      static Request Put(String url, Object... args)
      The PUT method requests that the enclosed entity be stored under the supplied Request-URI.
      String toUrl()
      Create and return the URL being used in the request.

      Adds an arbitrary entity to the request (used with POST/PUT).
      Request withForm(Object... args)
      Adds form parameters.
      Request withHeader(Object... args)
      Adds header parameters.
      Request withQuery(Object... args)
      Adds query parameters.

                             Object... args)

        args - the list of arguments to format the URL

      • Post

        public static Request Post(String url,
                           Object... args)
        The POST request method is designed to request that a web server accept the data enclosed in the request message's body for storage. It is often used when uploading a file or submitting a completed web form.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL
        args - the list of arguments to format the URL
        Returns:
        this

        args - the list of arguments to format the URL
        Returns:
        this

      • withContent

        public Request withContent(org.json.JSONObject json)
        Adds a JSON content to the request (used with POST/PUT). This will encapsulate the json into a StringEntity encoded with UTF-8 and use "application/json" as Content-Type
        Parameters:
        json - the JSONObject
        Returns:
        this

      • withContent

        public Request withContent(String content,
                           String contentType)
        Adds string content to the request (used with POST/PUT). This will encapsulate the string into a StringEntity encoded with UTF-8
        Parameters:
        content - the content to POST/PUT
        contentType - the HTTP contentType to use.
        Returns:
        this

      • withEntity

        public Request withEntity(org.apache.http.HttpEntity entity)

        Returns:
        this
